channel.title: Films on Tom Bishop
channel.description: Recent content in Films on Tom Bishop

item.title: 12 November 18
item.description: Ready Player One SCI-FI PICK OF THE WEEK Tom : Steven Spielberg's blockbuster Ready Player One is set in a dystopian 2045 where humans spend most of their time living in a VR system called OASIS.

item.title: 7 October 18
item.description: Sweet Virginia DRAMA PICK OF THE WEEK Tom : Christopher Abbott plays Elwood, a contract killer, hired in a small Alaskan town by a woman who wants to kill her husband for financial reasons.

item.title: 23 September 18
item.description: Tragedy Girls HORROR PICK OF THE WEEK Tom : Sadie and McKayla are high school aged best friends who run a true crime blog called 'Tradgedy Girls'. Enthusiasts of crime and serial murder they portray themselves as keen observers of their town’s spree of killings; however, they end up becoming more involved than the viewer initially expects.

item.title: 9 September 18
item.description: I, Tonya DRAMA PICK OF THE WEEK Tom : I, Tonya is based on the true story of US figure skater Tonya Harding who was implicated in the decapacitating assault of competing US figure skater Nancy Kerrigan.

item.title: 2 September 18
item.description: Mission Impossible: Fallout ACTION PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : I've never loved the Mission Impossible franchise. It falls into the same basket as James Bond for me - action that takes itself too seriously.

item.title: 29 July 18
item.description: Super Dark Times THRILLER PICK OF THE WEEK Tom : I really enjoyed this one. It's one of those films (and there's a few of them) that follow a group of kids or teenagers through some confronting or harrowing event.

item.title: 15 July 18
item.description: The Equalizer ACTION PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : This has got to be my favourite film genre. Tough-but-moral guy, out for revenge with a skill set that can not be matched. This came out in 2014 and I am not sure how we missed it then but I’m now very excited for the second one.

item.title: 1 July 18
item.description: Bone Tomahawk ACTION PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : We watched Bone Tomahawk because it was directed by S. Craig Zahler, the guy who did Brawl in Cell Block 99 (see the 5 - May Review), and we were not disappointed.

item.title: 23 June 18
item.description: Game Night COMEDY PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : Game Night was surprisingly good. The trailer made it out to be one those generic comedies filled with exaggerated caricatures, physical humour and outlandish awkward situations (think Sex Tape and Bad Teacher), but it was definitely better than that.

item.title: 16 June 18
item.description: Hereditary HORROR PICK OF THE WEEK Tom : Being our favourite genre Hannah and I watch a lot of horror movies so we’re quite desensitized. But this film was straight scary. So scary in fact that (and this is no joke) a woman in our cinema legitimately had a panic attack during the film’s climax; she was wailing and hyperventilating in the cinema, it was chaos.

item.title: 9 June 18
item.description: mother! DRAMA PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : The fact that this movie title conspicuously begins with a lowercase letter already hints at the weirdness that follows. It has a great cast – J-law, Jarvier Bardem, Michelle Pfeiffer (man that is a strange surname to spell) and Ed Harris, who all do a killer job.

item.title: 28 May 18
item.description: Whiplash DRAMA PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : Whiplash was great and intense. I was frustrated throughout and I hated both of the main characters, but I’m pretty sure that was intentional. It’s a story of a talented young musician and his ruthless and abusive teacher.

item.title: 21 May 18
item.description: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri DRAMA PICK OF THE WEEK Hannah : Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri has a really long title and a 2 hour run time and I didn’t want it to end.

item.title: 5 May 18
item.description: The Ritual HORROR Tom : The Ritual starts off on the PERFECT note. A bunch of guys are ominously planning an off-the-beaten track holiday followed by a completely unexpected, and ultra-realistic, liquor store robbery that leaves one character dead and the other guilt-stricken.

item.title: 21 April 18
item.description: Flatliners SCI-FI Hannah : The genre mash of science fiction and horror is one of my favourites, but Flatliners is an example of what happens when both are done badly. The movie’s central theme is about past sins and repentance, so you would think the goal is to see the characters as good humans who have made mistakes right?

item.title: 12 April 18
item.description: Ingrid Goes West COMEDY Tom : I really don’t know what to say about this movie. We literally had to stop it half way through (and pick it up a few days later) because it was so excruciatingly cringe inducing.
